result.execSummary:
The defendant Devon Michael Weeks was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Devon Michael Weeks is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Devon Michael Weeks was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: To DE in response to his request on 4-20-17 - Address has been corrected, updated copy of the Pymt Plan Agmt enclosed, and an explaination of the court waiving 1 pymt to correct the ongoing non pymt issue due to DE's warrant in Oct 2016.  Includes 14cm289, 16cm4. jaf

Mailing DE a copy of the original PPA he signed.  Clerk has updated the PPA to reflect his current bal & next due date.  DE to pay $50/mo comm 5-20-17 (Apr pymt deferred due to the DE misunderstanding where his pymts were at after WA was issued in Oct 2016 for his unpd Sept pymt-pymts have been 1 mo behind since).  DE is now current & will be mailed a copy of his PPA.  Includes 14CM289, 16CM4. jaf

Prior: 913 6th St, Hudson, WI 54016 United States

Per Mar pymt rec'd on 4-20-17.  DE has been behind 1 mo since Sept 2016.  WA not signed or copied out.  Court will quash as a courtesy & reissue a Pymt Plan after deferring 1 mo for this time ONLY.  Includes 14CM289, 16CM4. jaf

PAYH/ Order for payment on May 27, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
Atty. J. Caton. gme
c: Def, Atty, DA, SCSO & Jail. eif
signed by Def & Atty this date. eif
c: Def & Atty. eif
Review at 04-11-2016 07:45 am

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Michael Edward Nieskes DF ATTY: Joseph Robert Caton DF:  Devon Michael Weeks appeared from jail. Case called at 2:26. ADA Nieskes updates the court. Atty. Caton agrees. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to Ct 1  in 16CM04. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 in 16CM04. On motion of the State without objection, Crt dismisses Ct 2 in 16CM04. Sentencing arguments. Crt orders:
12 days St. Croix County Jail credit for 12 days time served. 
- Costs $443.00
- Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.


  Review scheduled for April 11, 2016 at 07:45 am.
Plea hearing at 01-11-2016 02:15 pm

**AMENDED**

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.  

- Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. Defendant must pay $5.00 fee at time of each UA test with an officer of the same sex.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Michael Edward Nieskes DF ATTY: Joseph Robert Caton DF: Devon Michael Weeks appeared. Case called at 4:32. ADA Nieskes updates the court there is a resolution and requests a plea date.  Plea hearing scheduled for January 11, 2016 at 02:15 pm.
Status conference at 01-06-2016 04:45 pm

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.  
- Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. Defendant must pay $5.00 fee at time of each UA test with an officer of the same sex.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA:  Matthew L Hartung   DF ATTY:  John A. Kucinski   DF:  Devon Michael Weeks appeared from jail via video conf. Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.  Waives speedy trial. ADA Hartung makes recommendations  Status conference scheduled for January 6, 2016 at 04:45 pm.
